data.title: The Best NBA Players from Arkansas
data.meta_description: Over 800 sports fans have voted on the 50+ athletes on Best NBA Players from Arkansas. Current Top 3: Scottie Pippen, Sidney Moncrief, Joe Johnson
data.text:
Ranked By

4.7K votes

807 voters

2 reranks

Voting Rules

Only NBA players born or raised in Arkansas.

Who are the best NBA players from Arkansas? Featuring Hall of Fame greats, superstars, and active players, this list of basketball players who were born in Arkansas includes Scottie Pippen, Sidney Moncrief, Derek Fisher, Mike Conley, and Joe Johnson. Who is the best NBA player from Arkansas?

Vote up the top Arkansas NBA players, and help decide who are the best basketball players from Arkansas.

Most divisive: Nat Clifton

Over 800 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The Best NBA Players from Arkansas

Birthplace : Hamburg, Arkansas

Team : Chicago Bulls, Portland Trail Blazers, Houston Rockets

Position : Small forward

A key component of the Chicago Bulls' six-championship dynasty, Scottie Pippen's tenacious defense and ability to excel as both a scorer and facilitator made him one of the most versatile players in NBA history. Known for his incredible wingspan and keen basketball IQ, Pippen undoubtedly left an indelible mark on the sport. Additionally, his partnership with Michael Jordan transformed the Bulls into a formidable force in the 1990s, setting the stage for Pippen's enduring legacy as one of the game's all-time greats.

Birthplace : Little Rock, Arkansas

Position : Shooting guard

Sidney Moncrief's impact on the court is best exemplified by his tenacious defensive skills and exceptional athleticism. As a member of the Milwaukee Bucks, he was a critical driving force that helped lead the team to multiple playoff appearances during the 1980s. Moncrief's prowess as a lockdown defender, coupled with his smooth scoring ability, solidified his place as one of the premier shooting guards of his generation.

Birthplace : Little Rock, Arkansas

Team : Phoenix Suns, Atlanta Hawks, Brooklyn Nets, Miami Heat, Utah Jazz

Position : Shooting guard

Known for his clutch performances and smooth scoring ability, Joe Johnson carved out a lengthy and impressive career in the NBA. His versatility allowed him to excel at multiple positions, becoming a matchup nightmare for opponents. A consistent offensive threat throughout his career, Johnson's influence and skill set have undoubtedly shaped the stylistic landscape of today's NBA.

Birthplace : Jacksonville, Arkansas

Team : Los Angeles Lakers, Miami Heat, Charlotte Hornets, New York Knicks, Houston Rockets

Position : Shooting guard, Small forward

An expert marksman whose shooting abilities rank among the best in NBA history, Glen Rice was a lethal offensive weapon throughout his career. With a smooth, quick release and a knack for creating his own shot, Rice was a constant scoring threat that forced defenses to adapt. His impact on the game is evident in the growing emphasis on three-point shooting and his influence on the next generation of sharpshooters.

Bobby Portis, a dynamic power forward, has quickly become a fan favorite due to his energy, toughness, and passion for the game. His ability to stretch the floor as a shooter and crash the glass unrelentingly makes him a valuable asset on both ends of the court. Portis' contributions are instrumental in helping his teams reach success, showcasing his commitment and determination to continue the proud tradition of NBA players hailing from Arkansas.

Birthplace : Little Rock, Arkansas

Team : Oklahoma City Thunder

Position : Point guard

Often remembered for his legendary buzzer-beaters and championship contributions with the Los Angeles Lakers, Derek Fisher was a quintessential role player. His timely shooting and unwavering work ethic made Fisher an integral part of the Lakers' championship runs during the early 2000s. As a consummate professional and natural leader, Fisher's presence and impact on the sport have extended well beyond his playing days.
